meanings.definition: Obtain (something) especially with care or effort.
meanings.sent1: She procures fresh vegetables from the market every morning.
meanings.sent2: He procures a rare book for his collection.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel procures nuts for the winter with great determination.
meanings.sent4: The detective procures crucial evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent5: The explorer procures a map to navigate through the dense jungle.

meanings.definition: Persuade or cause (someone) to do something.
meanings.sent1: He procures his friend to join him on the adventure.
meanings.sent2: She procures her brother to help with the chores.
meanings.sent3: The magician procures the audience to participate in the magic show.
meanings.sent4: The teacher procures the students to engage in the class discussion.
meanings.sent5: The coach procures the team to give their best performance in the game.
